TunableList.name: DEFAULT_GENDER_OPTION_TRAITS
TunableList.description: A mapping from gender to default gender option traits. After loading the sim's trait tracker, if no gender option traits are found (e.g. loading a save created prior to them being added), the tuned gender option traits for the sim's gender will be added.

TunableList.name: value
TunableList.description: The default gender option traits to be added for this gender.

TunableList.name: EXCLUSIVE_SET
TunableList.description: A list of trait groups to determine which traits are exclusive from each other within the same group. We will prevent a trait from being added if a trait with a higher weight excludes it. We will remove traits with a lower or equal weight when we add a new trait. For example: Group 1 has: Trait A, Weight 3 Trait B, Weight 2 Trait C, Weight 1 Group 2 has: Trait B, Weight 3 Trait D, Weight 1 Trait E, Weight 1 If our sim has Trait A and tries to add: Trait B will not be added. Trait C will not be added. Trait D will be added. Trait E will be added. If our sim has Trait B and tries to add: Trait A will remove Trait B and add Trait A. Trait C will not be added. Trait D will not be added. Trait E will not be added. If our sim has Trait C and tries to add: Trait A will remove Trait C and add Trait A. Trait B will remove Trait C and add Trait B. Trait D will be added. Trait E will be added. If our sim has Trait D and tries to add: Trait A will be added. Trait B will remove Trait D and add Trait B. Trait C will be added. Trait E will remove Trait D and add Trait E. If our sim has Trait E and tries to add: Trait A will be added. Trait B will remove Trait E and add Trait B. Trait C will be added. Trait D will remove Trait E and add Trait D.

Tunable.name: trait
Tunable.description: A trait in the exclusive group.

Tunable.name: weight
Tunable.description: The weight to determine if this trait should be added and remove other traits in the exclusive group, or not add this trait at all.

TunableList.name: GENDER_TRAITS
TunableList.description: A mapping from gender to trait. Any Sim with the specified gender will have the corresponding gender trait.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The trait associated with the specified gender.

TunableList.name: KNOWLEDGE_TRAIT_TYPES
TunableList.description: Sims are allowed to get knowledge about traits of these types.

TunableList.name: SPECIES_EXTENDED_TRAITS
TunableList.description: A mapping from extended species to trait. Any Sim of the specified extended species will have the corresponding extended species trait.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The trait associated with the specified extended species.

TunableList.name: SPECIES_TRAITS
TunableList.description: A mapping from species to trait. Any Sim of the specified species will have the corresponding species trait.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The trait associated with the specified species.

TunableList.name: TRAIT_INHERITANCE
TunableList.description: Define how specific traits are transferred to offspring. Define keys of sets of traits resulting in the assignment of another trait, weighted against other likely outcomes.

TunableTuple.description: A set of trait requirements and outcomes. Please note that inverted requirements are not necessary. The game will automatically swap parents A and B to try to fulfill the constraints. e.g. Alien Inheritance Alien inheritance follows a simple set of rules: Alien+Alien always generates aliens Alien+None always generates part aliens Alien+PartAlien generates either aliens or part aliens PartAlien+PartAlien generates either aliens, part aliens, or regular Sims PartAlien+None generates either part aliens or regular Sims Given the specifications involving 'None', we need to probably blacklist the two traits to detect a case where only one of the two parents has a meaningful trait: a_whitelist = Alien b_whitelist = Alien outcome = Alien a_whitelist = Alien b_blacklist = Alien,PartAlien outcome = PartAlien etc...

TunableList.name: outcomes
TunableList.description: A weighted list of potential outcomes given that the requirements have been satisfied.

TunableTuple.description: A weighted outcome. The weight is relative to other entries within this outcome set.

Tunable.name: weight
Tunable.description: The relative weight of this outcome versus other outcomes in this same set.

TunableList.name: parent_a_blacklist
TunableList.description: One of the parents must have ALL the traits specified in the Parent A Whitelist and none of the traits in the Parent A Blacklist.

TunableList.name: parent_a_whitelist
TunableList.description: One of the parents must have ALL the traits specified in the Parent A Whitelist and none of the traits in the Parent A Blacklist.

TunableList.name: parent_b_blacklist
TunableList.description: If either Parent A field has traits specified then the other parent must have all the traits specified in the Parent B Whitelist and none of the traits specified in the Parent B Blacklist. If both parents match the Parent A requirements (which would always be true if both Parent A fields are empty), then this passes if either of the parents match the Parent B requirements.

TunableList.name: parent_b_whitelist
TunableList.description: If either Parent A field has traits specified then the other parent must have all the traits specified in the Parent B Whitelist and none of the traits specified in the Parent B Blacklist. If both parents match the Parent A requirements (which would always be true if both Parent A fields are empty), then this passes if either of the parents match the Parent B requirements.
